New Records: Jordan Ayew scored a late winner for Ghana in extra time to secure a 1-2 victory over Mali in their 2026 FIFA World Cup Qualifier.
Kamoury Doumbia scored Mali's opening goal on the stroke of halftime with a shot that hit Alexander Djiku and rebounded in for his side.
Key Match Events: Jordan Ayew's late goal in extra time was the decisive moment of the match.
Ernest Nuamah scored an equalizer for Ghana in the first half with a header from Salis Samed's cross.
Ghana's substitutes, including debutant Ibrahim Sulemana, played key roles in the second half.
Mali made several substitutions to try to regain control but were unable to find an equalizer.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ghana moved to second place in the table with 6 points, while Mali remained third with 4 points.
The match was played at the Baba Yara Stadium in Ghana against Central African Republic next.
